Posts.Content: Mar 11, 2012 02:32PM rengeko wrote: thanks for all the replies-i don't know why everything is so hopeless right this minute.  i think i should tell my therapist the stuff she has me on (which costs a fortune, of course) doesn't seem to be working well.  i'm not normally a cheerful person, but i'm not normally this bad-i tend to be grimly determined and all i can do is stay awake until 7ish, these days.  i just want to go back to sleep.  classic sign of depression, i know.  another thing that's making me crazy is that my cat will not leave me alone-everytime i sit down she insists on being held, so she's acting all neurotic on top of everything.  i'm worried about the move, worried about her, worried about staying at my friend's place for a week while my stuff gets out there.  i'm REALLY used to living alone.

Posts.Content: Apr 1, 2012 03:57PM rengeko wrote: my therapist put me on some new meds, and they seem to have helped.  i'm still kind of off, but i'm able to do things now.  it's so odd, i'm now just obsessed with death.  i suppose that's going to be an ongoing theme.  i guess i'll see.

Posts.Content: rengeko wrote: i know this sounds awful, with everyone else having much more trouble, but i just keep getting depressed.  i mean, my scans are good and i'm just recently diagnosed-so i'm just at the beginning.  and it just keeps hitting me-so i get depressed again.  or never am not depressed, i can't even tell.  i'm taking antidepressants, but they don't seem to be able to beat the reality.  i'm alone, no husband or family, though i have a friend who is helping me and is willing to take care of me when i die.  my feet are still messed up from the chemo and i'm just getitng some hair back.  but i have to pack all my stuff and move out to seattle may 1st.  do we ever accept this? Posts.Content: Mar 11, 2012 07:02AM rengeko wrote: i appreciate everyone answering., i AM excited about the move, it's just a lot to process.  i have been trying to journal, but i keep writing what i do each day, rather than how i feel-have to work on that.  i guess one of the more depressing things is all the things i can't do anymore.  i barely have enough energy to get up most days, and the packing is suffering-i can't lift things like i used to, and i really don't have friends in town to help me out.  and then i think i'll hire someone, but worry about "what might happen" bringing a stranger in (now that i have a really serious sense of my vulnerability).  i suppose i'm being foolish-my scans are good.  but it turned out the mets to bone were ER-, and if they progress, i'm just not sure i can handle more chemo.  i know i should just let it go until it comes up, but i'm just not very good at that.  and as far as being present, that IS something i need to work on-i'm a buddhist and i need to meditate.

Posts.Content: rengeko wrote: i may have a new lymph node in my non-cancer armpit (though, it may be an old one, since i hardly bother with checking anymore, i mean, how is it going to get worse, right?) and i wonder if there's any reason to pay attention? i had a PET 6 wks ago, but it wasn't even mentioned as dead, so-maybe it's new? "No significantly FDG avid right axillary lymph nodes. " i guess that COULD mean it was there before, but it's not really specific. unfortunately, i don't have a copy-wait, my CT from last year, june shows NO enlarged nodes on R, but previous PET in 2012 does show uptake in R node, and i had a couple of bx on that side, but she described that as "very deep" and i'm finding this one very easily. it just seems like everything is calculated to make us crazy. nothing is ever just what it is. (also, not sick, so it's unlikely to be infection) basically, i guess i am wondering if anyone ever had progression that showed up like that after a recent PET? i mean, 6 wks seems awfully fast to show progression when it had been ...since june 2013 stable. any ideas? Posts.Content: Jan 6, 2015 12:25PM rengeko wrote: yeah, that's what i'm concerned about-i have one vein that is pretty much gone now, and i have a PET next week, and thinking about the ...joy of people trying to get through that scarring... obvs i'm going to have to do it this time, but i'm actually afraid they won't get it. bad enough i'm allergic to ct contrast, so those are basically pointless, but then to have a fairly good chance of not getting a vein for one of the few tests? and i have news-NO-ONE is getting a line in on one of my feet when i'm awake. or anywhere else, for that matter-a nurse, who i'll call "the assaulter" went for a vein out of the crook and IT HURT. i'm not a whiner, you understand, and there is no way i'm going to allow that again. i've had more than enough pain, i'm not going to allow it if i know it's going to hurt.

Posts.Content: Nov 13, 2014 12:04AM rengeko wrote: i just noticed this-and it's not like i wasn't completely panic-stricken. 1. In some listings, we specify that we will consider your impairment to be disabling until a particular point in time (for example, at least 18 months from the date of diagnosis). We may consider your impairment to be disabling beyond this point when the medical and other evidence justifies it. 2. When a listing does not contain such a specification, we will consider an impairment(s) that meets or medically equals a listing in this body system to be disabling until at least 3 years after onset of complete remission. When the impairment(s) has been in complete remission for at least 3 years, that is, the original tumor or a recurrence (or relapse) and any metastases have not been evident for at least 3 years, the impairment(s) will no longer meet or medically equal the criteria of a listing in this body system. 3. Following the appropriate period, we will consider any residuals, including residuals of the malignancy or therapy (see 13.00G), in determining whether you are disabled. If you have a recurrence or relapse of your malignancy, your impairment may meet or medically equal one of the listings in this body system again. got this off ssa.gov. does that mean NED? i mean, since we're always in treatment...

Posts.Content: Jun 3, 2012 04:50PM rengeko wrote: as far as i know, i have only one lesion on my sternum.  it was unbearably painful before treatment, but now, i have a little soreness.  i thought kathy rich died recently?  so i didn't catch it early enough to cure, but early enough to have very little effect.  i guess i can't complain really.  and i actually haven't trained in aikido since i was 30-so there's a lot of consideration.  i'm still about 60lbs overweight, too.  and in terrible shape.  yeah, i'm worried about bones and my port.  and my neuropathy.  but i have emailed the closest dojo and the sensei seems willing to work with me.  i'm going to observe a class on wed.  i'm really excited.  funny, my shoulders have finally healed up i think-just in time to damage them again.  i really only trained for about 3 months, but i really loved it.  and it has made me fall safely since-a real boon when on chemo, i fell off my porch like four times.  now THAT'S a side effect i can live with.

Posts.Content: Jun 3, 2012 03:12PM rengeko wrote: yeah-it's weird.  i mean, reading up on stage iv will make you go out and put a down payment at the crematorium.  @ petjunkie, i'm seeing specht-who do you see?  she did say something about shutting down my ovaries-but i'm not sure about it.  wouldn't that mean i would have to go onto an AI?  i'm on tamoxifen and have no appreciable side effects and i like it.  i'm still having trouble with my feet and a couple of fingers from the chemo-side effects are NOT what i'm looking for here. so i was thinking, if she thinks i'm ok, maybe i can go back to aikido.  i guess that sounds weird.  that was one of the things that made me so angry when i was dx.  i was going back to aikido-and then i couldn't.  i know i will need a lot of accommodation and it will hurt a lot, but i really did love it.  i feel funny having goals now.  i guess i'm not alone in all of this.  it's just so strange to read about everyone who is having "stage iv" type problems and to know my doc barely thinks i'm in that group.
